column1: Growing up in Aroostook County I learned the value of hard work that defines Maine's potato industry.  When COVID hit farmers like Robbie needed help. I delivered $14 million to support Maine's potato farmers.  Experience 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙨. #mepolitics https://t.co/9q03xMjbpT
Sen. Collins delivered more than $8 BILLION in COVID relief to Maine.   @SaraGideon did nothing. #mepolitics https://t.co/Kqrveeh9ka

When COVID hit Sen. Collins got to work. She wrote the Paycheck Protection Program which supported more than 250000 Maine jobs injected $2.3B into Maine's economy & provided forgivable loans to more than 28000 Maine small businesses. #mepolitics https://t.co/cQyMp8gixd

Sen. Collins delivered more than $8 BILLION in COVID relief to Maine to support public health our schools our economy & other purposes - that’s nearly double Maine's annual state budget. #mepolitics https://t.co/WpUdpj0q3u

The hospitality industry and its dedicated employees are critical to Maine's economy.   When COVID hit I wrote the Paycheck Protection Program which helped restaurants keep their doors open and continue paying their hardworking employees. #mepolitics https://t.co/G8w9GxsRSg

When COVID hit Sen. Collins got to work. She wrote the bipartisan Paycheck Protection Program which supported more than 250000 Maine jobs injected $2.3B into Maine's economy & provided forgivable loans to more than 28000 Maine small businesses. #mepolitics https://t.co/hlOW8lcM8i

When the coronavirus hit I immediately got to work and wrote the Paycheck Protection Program which protected more than 250000 Maine jobs and injected $2.3 billion into Maine's economy.  Experience 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙨. #mepolitics https://t.co/oiwsd9W1sp

I came up with the concept of the Paycheck Protection Program. It is the most successful part of our response to the economic devastation caused by the coronavirus.  Leadership 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙨. #mepolitics https://t.co/Ns33vEzmD4

When COVID hit Sen. Collins got to work. She wrote the Paycheck Protection Program which supported more than 250000 Maine jobs injected $2.3B into Maine's economy & provided forgivable loans to more than 28000 Maine small businesses.  Experience 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙨. #mepolitics https://t.co/31bhLs61k8

I visited Hartwell Farm & Jo’s Sugar House this morning in Gorham to celebrate Maine Maple Weekend!  I secured $23M in direct relief for farmers struggling due to COVID & successfully advocated for Maine’s maple syrup producers to be included in that funding. #mepolitics https://t.co/UGLpbhyjxA

When COVID hit I got to work. I wrote the Paycheck Protection Program which supported 255000 Maine jobs injected $2.3B into Maine's economy and provided forgivable loans to more than 28000 Maine small businesses.  Experience 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙨. #mepolitics https://t.co/V2F4x5yOs1

When COVID hit Sen. Collins delivered for Maine’s farmers: ✔️ Secured over $23M in direct relief for farmers ✔️ Advocated for maple syrup to be eligible for relief ✔️ Ensured Maine families & businesses were included in the Farmers to Family Food Box program #mepolitics https://t.co/pbzzt2bR9X

In early July Sen. Collins introduced a bipartisan bill with Sen. Feinstein that would provide the USPS with $25 billion to cover revenue losses or operational expenses due to COVID. #mepolitics https://t.co/nl8O9a6lTs

When COVID hit I got to work. I authored the Paycheck Protection Program which to date has pumped more than $2.3B into more than 28000 Maine small employers supporting more than 255000 jobs. The average # of employees at a Maine business that received PPP: 7. #mepolitics

When COVID hit Sen. Collins went to work to protect the health of Mainers & the well-being of our economy. She secured:  ✔️ $69M for testing ✔️ $413M for hospitals & health care providers ✔️ $114M for schools & colleges  Sen. Collins FIGHTS for Maine. #mepolitics #DecisionMaine

Tammra Ferraiolo of Owls Head: "When the coronavirus pandemic was sweeping the country Susan Collins authored the Paycheck Protection Program – which has helped keep people employed as our economy weakened."  #mepolitics #DecisionMaine https://t.co/XZrmadfhb4

When COVID hit dentistry in Maine was declared a non-essential service. I led the fight to find a common-sense solution which ensured Mainers had access to the timely safe oral healthcare they need. #mepolitics https://t.co/oBP7PHqixo

Dave Plowman of Hampden: "When COVID shut down our economy the Maine Legislature... shut down & went home. Collins went to work getting the PPP written & passed to get immediate help to small businesses & the families that depend on them." #mepolitics https://t.co/WHumqxN1Hq

Tim Tower small business owner: "Barnacle Billy's is important to our family & to our employees & their families. When COVID hit I didn't think we were going to make it. One of the major things that helped us get through this was the PPP written by Susan Collins." #mepolitics https://t.co/T0NSXKG361

Stopped by South Berwick this week to visit small business owners  & workers who’ve worked hard to keep their doors open amid COVID. Took home a delicious chicken pot pie for dinner. #mepolitics https://t.co/azioFXgE2Z

ICYMI: I joined WVOM to set the record straight on the 2006 postal reform bill and the $25B I'm working to secure to help the USPS deal with COVID-19 expenses. LISTEN HERE: #mepolitics https://t.co/fMmRMosRpp

Maine's lobstermen and women continue to suffer due to the trade war and the added impacts of COVID-19. They need IMMEDIATE federal relief and my colleagues and I are fighting to ensure it happens. #mepolitics https://t.co/Tnji59JRoS

Farmers are an integral part of Maine's rural communities. That's why I helped ensure the CARES Act included direct relief for farmers suffering due to COVID-19. Today nearly $20M in relief has been awarded to Maine's farmers & their families. #mepolitics https://t.co/GbLItAUonN

This $51.2 M investment at Puritan Medical Products will make a huge difference in Maine and throughout the country by boosting testing efforts to help reduce the spread of COVID-19 and safely reopen our communities. #mepolitics https://t.co/XU1EnWKBD5

In early July I introduced a bill w/ Sen. Feinstein that would provide the USPS with $25 B to cover revenue losses or operational expenses due to COVID. The Senate must return to Washington to consider a COVID package that includes this bill. #mepolitics https://t.co/bMlFCjS0pw
When the coronavirus hit these hardworking Mainers in Hampden had to continue providing for their families — the Paycheck Protection Program made it happen. #mepolitics https://t.co/DLPkPhcCMh

Ryan Lorrain of Norway: "Sen. Collins was instrumental in saving the nation's economy and protecting rural workers with the Paycheck Protection Program she authored when the COVID-19 pandemic struck." Thank you for your support Ryan! #mepolitics https://t.co/yIqDbzGmVd

Putting Maine first means putting our students first. That's why helping first-generation & low-income students is critical. This $5M for TRIO programs will support students who are facing increased challenges due to COVID-19. #mepolitics https://t.co/hEPU6DMyNT

Community Clinical Services in Lewiston provides high-quality health care to many older adults & low-income families. This funding will help support the center's efforts to fight COVID-19 through increased testing & tracing. #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/PLOAe6s1nd

Yesterday I questioned experts on COVID-19's disparate health impacts among older adults in communities of color. It's crucial the next relief bill include funding to keep older Americans healthy & frontline workers safe. #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/BxRFQ2bVhF

As scientists develop a COVID vaccine we must be proactive in ensuring all Americans are able to access it.  Sen. Reed & I are leading a group of 30 Senators to urge Congress to include at least $5.6B in the next relief bill to develop & support vaccine distribution. #mepolitics

Allene and Jeffrey Scott of Saco: "America needs bipartisan senators in Washington to effectively balance public health safety with economic recovery efforts to deal with COVID-19. Maine needs Collins' experienced strong advocacy..." #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/9VCfkNCE6B

USPS employees and services are essential especially to Maine's rural areas. We can't let funding for USPS run out. I introduced bipartisan legislation to provide $25B to cover losses or expenses related to COVID-19. #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/vF3gnYtOQS

When COVID-19 hit I got to work and created the Paycheck Protection Program which delivered funding to 3/4 of all Maine small employers and protected 200000 Maine jobs. #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/1ysKUhyptW

Pool Testing is an efficient way to help communities & schools reopen safely. Yesterday I questioned Dr. Fauci on this strategy that could quickly help identify COVID-19 & protect students teachers & other employees. #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/JW9Sjg4RdN

TUNE IN 📺: Today at 10 AM I will question health officials including Dr. Anthony Fauci about how to help states safely get back to school and work amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Watch the Senate Health Committee hearing LIVE #mepolitics https://t.co/3T9DgcIqLO

I joined my colleagues in advocating for this financial relief for Maine's lobstermen and women who have greatly suffered due to COVID-19 and the trade war. This is good news for one of Maine's most vital industries. #mepolitics #MESen https://t.co/uAQonJDbye

Maine has the nation's worst COVID-19 racial disparity. That's why this week at a Senate Health Committee hearing I urged the former CDC Director to take immediate action to address the racial disparity problem among COVID-19 cases in Maine. #mepolitics https://t.co/P72NQf91iJ

This $1.35 M awarded to Native Maine Produce & Specialty Foods will support Maine farmers and producers who are struggling with decreased demand and disrupted supply chains due to the effects of COVID-19. #MEPolitics #MESen https://t.co/wvx3ZfmgfN

Older Americans living in nursing homes need better protection from COVID-19. That's why I advocated for universal testing better access to PPE for our heroes on the front-line and policies enabling telehealth. #MESen #MEPolitics https://t.co/iO27N93Bfp

Older Americans are experiencing increased isolation and loneliness due to COVID-19. Through the CARES Act I was able to move funding from in-person meal sites to meal delivery services so seniors could continue to receive a meal and a sense of connection. #MEPolitics #MESen https://t.co/C5Gfkg54dk

Hon. Karen Gerrish of Lebanon: "Whether it's coauthoring the vital PPP legislation during the COVID-19 crisis or bringing back defense contracts for Bath Iron Works or Portsmouth Naval Shipyard Sen. Collins knows how to deliver for the people of the state of Maine." #MEPolitics https://t.co/kIsWFCzSMk
COVID-19 has placed a significant burden on our potato farmers that's why I'm calling for the USDA to provide potato farmers direct relief and address the backlog. #MEpolitics https://t.co/PA63TRuQ8p

Roger Katz of Brunswick: "In this COVID-19 crisis Senator Collins is really standing tall... Susan is using those bipartisan skills to actually get something done in D.C. Not just for Maine but for our country." Thank you Roger for your support! #MEPolitics https://t.co/iYlcIe3ZuD

U.S. Postal service employees & services are essential especially to Maine's rural area. We can't let funding for USPS run out that's why I'm fighting to include emergency funding for the U.S. Postal service in the next COVID-19 relief bill. #MEpolitics https://t.co/nmxg1PlUbx

Maine farmers can now apply for direct relief through the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP). If your operation has been directly impacted by COVID-19 then visit here: https://t.co/gwyuANRxfr for more information. https://t.co/f03giyrM3X

Agriculture is an integral part of the fabric of Maine's rural communities. That's why I introduced legislation that would provide Maine's agriculture economy and food supply chain the tools needed to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic. #MEpolitics https://t.co/4McPORimPc

I am so pleased to announce a bipartisan bill that I co-sponsored the SAFR Act passed unanimously out of the Senate. This important bill makes sure that the families of first responders who have died from COVID-19 can quickly access survivor benefits. #MEpolitics

During the COVID-19 crisis Congress has shown that it is capable of working across the aisle to find solutions that protect Americans. We must continue to work together to reopen our society. #mepolitics https://t.co/yI4hzfQWCW

“Maine Sen. Susan Collins announced that Maine has received a total of $4339566 in the 2nd installment of funding to support affordable housing reduce homelessness and bolster COVID-19 prevention and response efforts throughout the state.” #mepolitics https://t.co/KbqxPJv2gL
This week I questioned federal health officials about the way Remdesivir and other potentially life saving drugs to treat COVID-19 will be distributed. #mepolitics

In case you missed it I joined Matt Gagnon on WGAN Morning News to discuss the federal response to COVID-19 along with other important issues we are currently working on in the US Senate. #mepolitics  https://t.co/X8seNfuQ7Q

The COVID-19 crisis is having a devastating impact on our way of life and we need help from DC. Businesses want to safely reopen and Mainers want to get back to work. In the meantime I have been working hard to secure the resources we’ll need to get us through this. #mepolitics https://t.co/DWrxgNnRQa

We all know a teacher who has gone far above and beyond to stay connected to their students during this COVID-19 crisis. Tag them here and be sure to thank them! #thankateacher https://t.co/W3bZ5OnEj3

Maine’s seafood farmers rely heavily on the restaurant industry so they have been hit particularly hard by the COVID-19 crisis. That’s why I joined the rest of the Maine delegation in requesting relief for this important industry. #mepolitics https://t.co/K2pN0gLDOs

“Sen. Collins also deserves a heartfelt thank-you for not only supporting Medicare Advantage but also for all the work she is doing to protect Maine’s residents from coronavirus. In a time of much uncertainty I am glad we have a leader in Sen. Collins.” https://t.co/bccj2vbhvb
In case you missed it I joined @WABI_TV5 last Friday to answer questions from their viewers about the COVID-19 pandemic. #mepolitics  https://t.co/CqeolAD6wu

Thanks to @AARPMaine for hosting a statewide call with 7500 Mainers this week to discuss resources that are available to help during the COVID-19 crisis. It was a pleasure to participate and to hear from their members. #mepolitics https://t.co/SQu50b4lXZ
Maine workers at so many companies in our great state are putting people first during the coronavirus pandemic and we thank all of you! #mepolitics https://t.co/FIdBAwPqfW
Seniors are already experiencing a time of great stress and uncertainty due to the COVID-19 pandemic. #mepolitics

These are troubling times for Maine and our country but everywhere you look there are heroes serving on the frontlines of the fight against coronavirus. Please share this video as a way of saying 'Thank you' to those who bravely go to work every day. #mepolitics https://t.co/v1QAr3Bqrh

As our colleges and universities move to online classes to combat the spread of COVID-19 student veterans should continue to receive the benefits that they earned through their service to our country. #mepolitics
1) The coronavirus pandemic is challenging our health and our nation’s economy in ways we haven’t seen since 9/11.

This morning I called into Mike Violette’s show on Legacy 1160 to discuss the latest on the federal government’s response to the #coronavirus and what can be done to assist Maine businesses that are already struggling as a result of this pandemic.  https://t.co/FtPCDpzBzz

As Chairman of the Senate Aging Committee I joined Ranking Member Bob Casey (D-PA) to urge the Dept of HHS to take swift action to protect older Americans from coronavirus. It is critical for the Department to consider their unique needs in all aspects of our domestic response.

Last week Congress acted swiftly to advance a $7.8 billion package to fight the coronavirus. Through these funds the Maine CDC will receive $4.6 million to support the effort to reduce the risk of exposure properly diagnose patients and treat Mainers who contract the virus.

WATCH: This morning I met with Maine health care leaders in Augusta who are on the frontlines of fighting the coronavirus pandemic to discuss which resources they will need to fight the spread of this disease in Maine.  https://t.co/9zMD4VtS0o

With presumptive positive cases of coronavirus now in Maine it’s important to take measures to educate yourself on how to prevent the spread of this disease.  Maine CDC has set up a website to keep us all posted with the latest updates. https://t.co/m7nhdOZX1U
If you are feeling symptoms please get tested and take measures to protect your friends and neighbors. Visit the Maine CDC's website for more information about coronavirus.  https://t.co/sQX5x1Sc23
